DOC.brief_title: Use Topical Liquid Diclofenac Following Laser Microporation Cutaneous Neurofibromas Patients With NF1
DOC.detailed_description: Neurofibromatosis type 1 ( NF1 ) autosomal dominant neurocutaneous syndrome highly variable clinical manifestation worldwide incidence approximately 1/2500 . The common lesion cutaneous neurofibroma , appear skin 90 % adult NF1 . The number cutaneous neurofibromas affect individual vary several thousand . These lesion may surgically remove , typically recur , surgical removal often lead scar . The secondary objective study ass safety use topical diclofenac treatment cutaneous neurofibromas patient NF1 .
